qas.question: In what roles did cardinals have important roles?
What Caridinal had powers so great that he basically ran France?
Which cardinal acted a the leader of France due to his amount of power?
Who is the only person to ever become a cardinal king?
What role did priests have in secular affairs?
Who did not take powerful positions in government?

plausible_answers.text: Richelieu successor was also a cardinal, Jules Mazarin. Guillaume Dubois and André-Hercule de Fleury

qas.question: What five great cardinals once ruled France?

context: In early modern times, <b5_0>cardinals<b5_0/> often had <b4_0>important roles<b4_0/> in <a0_0>secular affairs.<a0_0/> In some cases, they took on powerful positions in government. In Henry VIII's England, his chief minister was <b6_0>Cardinal Wolsey<b6_0/>. <a1_0><a2_0>Cardinal Richelieu<a2_0/><a1_0/>'s power was so great that he was for many years effectively the ruler of France. <b7_0><b8_0>Richelieu<b7_0/> successor was also a cardinal, Jules Mazarin. Guillaume Dubois and André-Hercule de Fleury<b8_0/> complete the list of the "four great" cardinals to have ruled France.[citation needed] In Portugal, due to a succession crisis, one cardinal, <a3_0>Henry, King of Portugal<a3_0/>, was crowned king, the only example of a cardinal-king.
